definition: abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must
ordinary/commonplace/mundane/temporal/of the material world (as opposed to supernatural or immortal levels)/every/all/whatever/altogether/gist/outline/note of Chinese musical scale
echo/sound/noise/to make a sound/to sound/to ring/loud/classifier for noises

sentences.english: Sometimes the simplest gesture can make a big statement.
sentences.chinese: 有时候最简单的举动也非同凡响。

sentences.english: The process makes the outcome seem all the more remarkable.
sentences.chinese: 制作工序使出来的成果非同凡响。

sentences.english: Its unusual colour is shared by only a handful of other plants.
sentences.chinese: 它非同凡响的色彩在其他植物中是非常稀罕的。

sentences.english: An unusual rhythm will soothe the ear.
sentences.chinese: 会有一非同凡响的节奏悦人之耳。

sentences.english: Today, we make another significant announcement.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我们发布了一条非同凡响的通告。

definition: lit. not a common chord (idiom); outstanding/brilliant/out of the common run
out of the ordinary/out of the common run
out of the ordinary/unusually (good, talented etc)
as many as/no less than/not inferior to/as good as/on a par with
lit. name is not in vain (idiom); a fully justified reputation/enjoys a well-deserved reputation
accurate to perfection (idiom)/precise to the finest detail
unprecedented and never to be duplicated/the first and the last/unmatched/unique
it goes to show that/one can see
